    • setOnClose

      public void setOnClose(@Nullable @Nullable SocketManager.OnCloseHook onClose)
      Description copied from interface: SocketManager
      Hook which allows doing cleanup before and after the SocketManager is closed
      Specified by:
      setOnClose in interface SocketManager<IN extends Packet,ACK_IN extends AckPacket,ACK_OUT extends AckPacket,OUT extends Packet>
      Parameters:
      onClose - hook which will be called on socket close. The actual SocketManager close method will be passed as a parameter and the hook itself will be in charge of calling it at what it deems to be the right time.

    • send

      public void send(OUT p) throws IOException
      Description copied from interface: SocketManager
      Send a packet and wait for an ack. The given packet is wrapped in a SimpleSeqPacket and the SimpleSeqPacket.seqN() is set. The packet is added to a queue to be sent. Wait for a SimpleAckPacket with SeqAckPacket.seqAck() == SimpleSeqPacket.seqN()
      Specified by:
      send in interface SocketManager<IN extends Packet,ACK_IN extends AckPacket,ACK_OUT extends AckPacket,OUT extends Packet>
      Parameters:
      p - packet to be sent
      Throws:
      IOException - if sending and/or receiving fails
      InterruptedIOException - if interrupted while sending and/or receiving

    • send

      public <R extends ACK_IN> SocketManager.PacketReplyContext<ACK_IN,ACK_OUT,R> send(OUT p, Class<R> replyType) throws IOException
      Description copied from interface: SocketManager
      Send a packet and wait for an ack. The given packet is wrapped in a SimpleSeqPacket and the SimpleSeqPacket.seqN() is set. The packet is added to a queue to be sent. Wait for an AckPacket of the given type and with SeqAckPacket.seqAck() == SimpleSeqPacket.seqN()
      Specified by:
      send in interface SocketManager<IN extends Packet,ACK_IN extends AckPacket,ACK_OUT extends AckPacket,OUT extends Packet>
      Parameters:
      p - packet to be sent
      replyType - type of the AckPacket to wait for
      Returns:
      SocketManager.PacketReplyContext the context of the received ack
      Throws:
      IOException - if sending fails
      InterruptedIOException - if interrupted while receiving

    • receive

      public <R extends IN> SocketManager.PacketReplyContext<ACK_IN,ACK_OUT,R> receive(Class<R> type) throws IOException
      Description copied from interface: SocketManager
      Wait for a packet of the given type
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      type - type of the Packet to wait for
      Returns:
